ID: Daily-Mail_2024-03-15_Moment-Sopranos-star
Source: Daily-Mail
Title: #DS Moment Sopranos star Michael Imperioli shoves climate change protesters out of 'An Enemy of the People' Broadway performance #DE
Content: #DS #PH #CS Climate change activists interrupted a performance of the Broadway play An Enemy of the People (Alt: The image shows a crowded theater audience seated in red chairs watching what appears to be a disruption during a Broadway performance. Two men are standing in the aisle among the seated audience members, with one wearing a white t-shirt. The theater has typical Broadway venue architecture with multiple levels visible in the background.) #CE
This is the wild moment Sopranos actor Michael Imperioli shoved climate change activists out of the theatre midway through his Broadway performance of An Enemy of the People.On Thursday night, three environmental activists from the group Extinction Rebellion halted the show by shouting #MS 'no theater on dead planet' #ME during the beginning of the second act.One protestor was then seen being escorted out of the theatre by cast members, including Imperioli, who shoved and dragged the rebel up the stairs - all while remaining in character.In a video posted on X, formerly know as Twitter, a protestor is seen walking on to the stage while stars Imperioli and Jeremy Strong, who plays Kendall Roy in Succession, were in the middle of performing a rather tense scene. #MS 'I am very, very sorry to interrupt your night and this amazing performance. I am a theater artist,' the rebel shouted before being escorted offstage by security.The protestor continued: 'The oceans are rising. It will swallow this city and this entire theater whole. I am putting my career on the line because we are not doing anything about this crisis. The water is coming for us!' #ME #DE
#PH #CS Michael Imperioli (left), who plays Christopher Moltisanti in the show Sopranos, told the protestors to 'go back to drama school' (Alt: The image shows two men in business suits standing close together indoors. The man on the left wears a dark pinstriped suit with a dark tie, while the man on the right wears a lighter pinstriped suit with a patterned tie. They appear to be in a professional or formal setting with wooden interior elements visible in the background.) #CE
#NS 'Go back to drama school!' Imperioli yelled in true gangster fashion.Strong, still in character retorted loudly 'let them speak.' #NE #DS Imperioli then left the stage and helped to shove the activist up the stairs and out of the theater. When the final activist was kicked out of the theatre, the majority of the room applauded. #DE #PS Imperioli posted a response to the incident on Instagram, suggesting that while his persona might not agree with the demonstrators, he still values science.'Tonight was wildâ€¦.no hard feelings extinction rebellion crew,' he wrote. 'Michael is on your side but mayor stockmann is not. Much love.' #PE #MS A statement released by the climate change group said: 'Today's action highlights the failure of governments and corporations to treat climate and ecological breakdown as the crisis it is.' #ME
#PH #CS A group called Extinction Rebellion was responsible for the protest (Alt: A man in a brown jacket and white t-shirt with a circular logo stands in the aisle of a theater, surrounded by seated audience members in red theater seats. The scene appears to be during a Broadway performance disruption, with the man appearing to be one of the protesters mentioned in the context.) #CE
